intro: Bunium minutifolium, commonly known as dwarf fernweed, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Bunium minutifolium is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
